alert.note: Alert for Meigs; Rhea (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 1:31PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Rhea, east central Sequatchie, central Bledsoe, central Meigs and north central Hamilton Counties through 315 PM EDT/215 PM CDT/... At 231 PM EDT/131 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dunlap, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dayton, Dunlap, Decatur, Graysville, Evensville, Sale Creek, Flat Top Mountain, Old Washington, Brayton and Mowbray Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT/700 PM CDT/ for east Tennessee.
